channel.title: briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Ex-Fed Governor Kugler quit after more trading violations
item.description: Kugler requested a waiver to conduct financial transactions to address what the Fed official described as impermissible financial holdings.

item.title: If You Want a Business That’s Built to Last, Start With Your ‘Why’
item.description: In a sea of sameness, your “why” is your greatest competitive advantage.

item.title: The Trump administration engaged in a ‘concerted campaign to purge’ left-wing views from top universities, judge says in UCLA funding case
item.description: The ruling bars the Trump administration from cutting federal funding to UCLA over antisemitism claims.

item.title: Yeti just did the unthinkable: Hire an ad agency
item.description: Outdoors brand Yeti dropped its new holiday commercial, and it has a lot of what you’d expect from a seasonal spot. “Bad Idea” outlines all the reason...

item.title: The Pause That Makes You a Better Leader
item.description: The moments when you feel triggered are the best learning opportunities.

item.title: What Great Leaders Do When the Ground Keeps Shifting
item.description: When change is the only constant, adaptability is your best strategy.

item.title: Ethics: My new employee refuses to do some parts of her job. Should I fire her?
item.description: A reader writes: I have a new employee who is refusing to do some parts of her job. She hasn’t done this with me directly, but when I left for a week’...

item.title: ‘The system’s about to break’ — Thousands of court-appointed lawyers and staffers haven’t been paid since June
item.description: A spending bill pending for 2026 comes up $196 million short and money to pay these federal attorneys will likely run out in June.

item.title: The NFL spent millions to transform Real Madrid’s stadium for a single game
item.description: New locker rooms. Rows of seats removed. Every last Real Madrid sign hidden from sight. These are just some of the measures the National Football Leag...

item.title: How Great Leaders Turn Constraints Into Creative Breakthroughs
item.description: Constraints focus energy. When that energy uplifts and connects, creativity flourishes.

item.title: ‘A national security problem and a homeland security problem’: The world targets Southeast Asia’s notorious scam centers
item.description: The U.S. announced on Thursday that it will start a new "Scam Center Strike Force" to target cybercriminals based in Southeast Asia

item.title: If you think beef is expensive now, just wait until next year when prices could soar nearly 60%
item.description: "Families are going to see $10-a-pound ground beef in the grocery store."

item.title: Housing market shift: 21 major markets seeing the strongest move toward buyers

item.title: How to Tell Whether You’ve Plateaued Because of Purpose or People
item.description: Plateaus don’t mean you’re failing. They mean you’re being called to evolve.

item.title: This week in business: Shutdown chaos, AI jitters, and a penny farewell
